recommended_movies: Girl with the Dragon Tattoo, The (2011)

simulated_ratings.title: Gravity (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tense, immersive survival in space worked even if it felt more spectacle than substance for me.

simulated_ratings.title: Cabin in the Woods, The (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Clever riff on horror tropes that kept me grinning as much as squirming.

simulated_ratings.title: Fahrenheit 9/11 (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Provocative and angry, not always balanced but compelling enough to keep me engaged.

simulated_ratings.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: The hyper-stylized video-game aesthetic wore thin fast despite a few witty beats.

simulated_ratings.title: Lost in Translation (2003)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Quiet, wistful chemistry and mood pulled me in even when the pace drifted.

simulated_ratings.title: Oculus (2013)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Solid concept and atmosphere, though the timeline jumps dulled the scares a bit.

simulated_ratings.title: Prometheus (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gorgeous, intriguing sci-fi that I enjoyed despite some head-scratching choices.

simulated_ratings.title: Trinity and Beyond (1995)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Stunning archival footage and sober context made this history both fascinating and chilling.

simulated_ratings.title: Let Me In (2010)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Moody, well-acted horror with a tender core that worked for me even as a remake.

simulated_ratings.title: Burn After Reading (2008)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Darkly funny and mean-spirited in a way that amused me more than it moved me.

simulated_ratings.title: Margin Call (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Tight, talky pressure-cooker that scratched my itch for smart crisis drama.

simulated_ratings.title: Blair Witch Project, The (1999)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Effective dread in the woods, though the found-footage gimmick wears on me.

simulated_ratings.title: Bourne Ultimatum, The (2007)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Propulsive and satisfying spy thrills that still feel sharper than the later entry.

simulated_ratings.title: Descendants, The (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Earnest and humane, but its mellow vibe kept me at arm’s length.

simulated_ratings.title: Bourne Supremacy, The (2004)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Solid mid-arc chase and paranoia, a bit shaky and less memorable for me.

simulated_ratings.title: To Catch a Spy (2021)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lightweight TV-movie mystery with little spark beyond the location.

simulated_ratings.title: The Martian (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Smart, upbeat survival science had me rooting and smiling throughout.

simulated_ratings.title: Super 8 (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Nostalgic thrills that entertained me even if the sentimentality felt a bit thick.

simulated_ratings.title: Zero Dark Thirty (2012)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Gripping procedural intensity that kept me absorbed start to finish.

simulated_ratings.title: Arrival (2016)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Thoughtful, emotionally resonant sci-fi that hit my sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Girl with the Dragon Tattoo, The (2011)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Dark, methodical investigation anchored by compelling leads.

simulated_ratings.title: Bourne Identity, The (2002)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Lean, efficient spy mystery that still feels fresh.

simulated_ratings.title: Up in the Air (2009)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Slick, melancholy character study with sharp observations and just enough warmth.

simulated_ratings.title: Chris Rock: Selective Outrage (2023)

simulated_ratings.title: Talented Mr. Ripley, The (1999)

simulated_ratings.title: Death Proof (2007)

simulated_ratings.title: Ocean's Eleven (2001)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Breezy, stylish caper fun with just enough snap to satisfy.

simulated_ratings.title: Steve Jobs (2015)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Rapid-fire, stagey character portrait that I found absorbing and brisk.

simulated_ratings.title: Wallace & Gromit: The Best of Aardman Animation (1996)
simulated_ratings.feeling: A witty, handcrafted sampler where the stop-motion charm and dry gags hit my sweet spot.

simulated_ratings.title: Wallace & Gromit: The Wrong Trousers (1993)

simulated_ratings.title: Dune (1984)
simulated_ratings.feeling: Messy but intriguing space opera whose world-building appeals even as the execution wobbles.

simulated_ratings.title: Toy Story (1995)

simulated_ratings.title: Eraserhead (1977)

simulated_ratings.title: Wallace & Gromit in The Curse of the Were-Rabbit (2005)

simulated_ratings.title: Stuart Little (1999)

simulated_ratings.title: Chicken Run (2000)

simulated_ratings.title: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers (1954)

simulated_ratings.title: Stuart Little 2 (2002)

simulated_ratings.title: Shaun the Sheep Movie (2015)

simulated_ratings.title: One Piece Film Z (2012)
